reviews.review_msg: A fun class. Dr. Elliott is knowledgeable in what she teaches. The best part of this course are the tutorials: You get to do fun activities. Journals take effort but they are worth it. To do well you have to really read all the materials and view the DVDs. Guest speakers are inspirational and takes the class to a higher level. Great class and prof!

AWESOME!  This class is amazing.  Extremely recommended.  It gives a new perspective on CJS in a way you can actually learn and reflect on.  It is not a class where you have to read and memorize but learning through interaction.  And if your shy, dont be!  Melissa (TA) is extremely approachable and creates a welcoming environment :)

Best prof I ever had, class is pretty easy, you just need to show up and write journals. There is not text book, you get to watch DVD's. Liz is really helpful, she has some good stories and keep the topics covered interesting. Good times :)
Avoid this class if you are not good in writting papers.

Don't take it by dist ed.  If you don't know how to write journals, you will have a problem.  There are no guidelines to begin with and the TA doesn't help much in that area.  They expect you to read 3 x 20pg articles and 3 ch. per week and integrate them into 3 pages while incorporating personal experience...most useless class I ever took.

I took this class by distance ed so I didn't get to meet the prof..but overall it was quite easy. The journal expectations were not clearly illustrated but it was ok. It was a bit time consuming thinking about your own, personal experience with restorative justice.
I took distance ed. so i dont know about the prof, but this course is by far the easiest upper crim course i took.
easy class. excellent TA's. lectures were somewhat boring, but guest speakers were interesting. if you're in favor of capital punishment, etc, this class will piss u off.
hot smart and funny
hot hot hot hot hot
This class was allright. Have to do a lot of work eventually, however it was fun and interesting.

Wow, I really can't believe that students would give Liz a bad rating.  I have learned alot from the classes and I think that she is very open to other ideas (even if they are opposite to her own).  In my opinion, she is very knowledgable and the work she does (outside of Uni!) is to be commended.

Course was extremely easy. I didn't enjoy writing the weekly journals though because I was running out of things to say the last couple of weeks. Course material is as left wing as you can get. If you don't lean left prepare to be frustrated at the readings.
Good class, very little workload.  Tutorials are easy, and the final quiz was unbelievably easy!!  The class is quite left-leaning, but cynicism and doubts are accepted.

she knows the material & is prepared but a lot of the info was repetitive after some weeks. weekly journals weren't difficult to do but the TAs marked hard. go to the tutorials cuz you get to do fun activities!
no exams, no paper, 1 journal each week. what more could you ask for. EASY EASY EASY. No need for lectures or reading. material is fun to learn though, so go to the tutorials.

Liz's class is excellent, and it really opens your eyes to what is actually going on in the criminal justice system. The lectures were very interesting, and it is an awesome class to take. I highly reccommend it.

Well, not much I can say about Liz. She showed up prepared, but the material was very repetitive.  If you like easy marks then take this class, but if you are in school to learn something take another.  You learn very little in this class, and anything you do learn is repeated the entire semester.
Tries to impose her views on her students and leaves little room for personal decisions and opinions . over all not bad
The easiest class ever in the school of Criminology, Enough said!
Liz!  You are the bomb!  You truly helped to reformulate my notions of restorative justice and my stance on punishment of offenders.  Thank you!

Liz is a super professor who genuinely enjoys explaining Restorative Justice and the concepts that go along with it. Plus, No midterm, no paper (except for journals), no final = 1 Helluva sweet course!
Liz is wonderful!  She makes sense and teaches you to really 'think out side of the box.'  She's the best prof up at SFU
Helpful, interesting and inspiring
Interesting views, very helpful, understanding.
very interesting, very funny and helpful, give you chance as long as you ask

unorganized does not begin to describe her, does not post/open materials on time, provides criteria for papers then reveals weeks after the due date that it was graded on criteria never told to students to make it more difficult to get an A, the semester is almost done and we have not received a single grade back for the entire course

Brenda's lectures are pretty much pointless. Assignment guidelines/rubric are nonexistent. She is also extremely disorganized. The tutorials are just games and ice breaker activities. The TAs are nice but Brenda does not seem to put any effort into this class. We had a critical essay assignment due during reading week so that was quite annoying.
I cannot urge you enough donot take this course. The assignment guidelines and vague, Tutorials are a waste of time and the work load is huge and sporadic simply because this prof is unorganized.

Brenda is genuinely one of the worst profs I have had as a 4th year. She is so messy, we are a month into the course and she has been so unprepared. She doesn't reply to e-mails AT ALL, her lectures are so jumbled that I don't even watch them anymore because they teach nothing. Only plus is the TA so far is absolutely lovely

this class is so interesting so its extremely disappointing that for an online class students have to beg the professor to post the weekly materials and she neglects to open assignments til right before the deadline but does not provide extensions. She seems nice but sfu should have someone else who can actually support the students run the course

CRIM 315 as a 4-credit course was awesome. It was weekly worksheets, discussions, and tutorials. The tutorials were the only ones I liked my whole academic career! For anyone who didn't enjoy it, simply were too lazy to do the super easy weekly things. The papers were long which is the downside. She records her lectures, no attendance is needed.

Great and engaging tutorials. We would literally play games for about an hour. 2 papers, first one is 12-14 pages and the second one is 16-18 pages. I have no problem with Brenda because her lectures were online, to which I never attended. However, all you need to do is show up to fun tutorials and write papers.

Brenda was consistently having "wifi problems" which led to her posting lectures weeks late, or not at all.  She has high expectations for students engagement, but engaged very little herself.  Never answered any emails.  Appeared to be prioritizing other projects and pursuits over her students and the course.  Course papers were especially long.

(it was Crim 103)super sad excuse for a criminology class, worst class ive taken in my young academic career, she has so many different excuses to not show up for online lecture, the worksheets seemed to barely relate to course content. Dropped stats 203 to take this course, shouldve just stayed in there.

Best class of my undergrad. people who didn't do well did not work hard, because the TA and prof both had very clear instructions had 4th year students taken the initiative and simply asked. Brenda was so accommodating of my personal issues. Dana, Best TA ever. Don't hesitate to take this class, and put in the work to get the grade I got.

Brenda is a really nice lady, but she assigned so much homework and her papers are unnecessarily long. 
Would not take another class with her

The TAs will mark your papers so hard. This class is NOT a gpa booster. Final paper was 16-18 pages what can you even talk about past the 10th page?? Literally repeated myself through the entire essay.

She was pretty absent for the majority of the semester, as a person she is caring towards the students, however with her lack of presence due to attending conferences it was hard to evaluate her teaching style.

She is not your average professor! she talks to students like equals and embraces real life learning techniques instead of tradition readings exams and lectures. I love her, and have taken plenty of classes with her. if you are interested in what shes teaching, you will learn! and if youre like me, you will be inspired !!

Brenda is a very kind and knowledgeable Professor, but she is quite disorganized in class and hard to listen to at times. That being said, attending lecture is not at all necessary in 315 because there are no exams and the papers are based on readings and lecture notes posted online. Simply attend tutorials and you are ok-TA KRYSTAL IS AWESOME!

Brenda doesn't teach and only gives you information in support of her ideas. It's not worth your time to attend class. Tutorial is 2 hours of ice breaking games each week and not much else. Paper dates changed without warning. The only positive is that the grading is reasonable and if you put in some effort you can pull off a good grade.

Her lectures are quite unique. She will often show short videos and bring in guest speakers. 30% of your grade comes from easy tasks such as worksheet, reflections, and tutorial participation. I would suggest that 315 with Brenda Morrison is one of the funnest classes you will take. Tutorials are not like typical crim tutorials at all. They are fun

Took it online. Weekly Canvas discussions (25%), eight 700 word journals (50%), and one 8 - 10 page paper (25%). Not very much work for a 4-credit course. Extremely easy to do well. Very inspirational material. However, grading criteria is very vague. Gives little direction for assignments and discussions. Otherwise would highly recommend.

Neither Brenda or her TA's respond to e-mails. Unclear expectations on papers. Sends out a million e-mails that have nothing to do with the course. Didn't learn anything really and I was very interested in RJ. Tutorials are a waste of time where you do exercises talking about your feelings. I think RJ at SFU needs to be overhauled
Very disorganized and unclear of expectations on papers.

I liked the course. If students read the book, incorporated the Restorative Justice (RJ) events that were going on around town, went to your tutorials and spoke up and gave an informed opinion about RJ, you would have done well. Brenda's a fair marker. She gave examples of what a critical analysis encompases. Get someone to read your papers.

I tried extremely hard to get A in Brenda's class, but received a B mark.  Brenda is a hard marker, but a very poor instructor.  The class is filled with cheap sentimentalism that Brenda thoroughly encouraged.  Brenda gave vague verbal instructions for the essays that are worth 35% each. Brenda, please give written and detailed instructions.
Horrible should not be teaching I'm not sure how she can teach
Her lecture was boring and useless. Only thing interesting was the guest lectures. So basically she taught us nothing.

Did not like this class. She constantly sends emails about events and passed on emails from other people but does not reply to students. Unclear and disorganized. A lot of work but it took about 4 or 5 weeks to return our first 12pg paper out of 3. This class had to final exam, it was my first class finished and is the last class to send in marks.
I would not recommend her for Crim 315. She does not reply to students email and all you see if her emailing about her events. She looks down on students.

The class is great, but the prof's inability to be organized ruins the exp. She has unrealistic  expectations and a hefty workload even when she knows she cant mark them in time. You get details of your assignments one week before it's due. 3 papers; each is 12 pgs long. She won't reply to emails and leaves students concerned w/o addressing them.

Must take class! Great experience. Brenda Morrison is a great lecturer, and very knowledgeable of restorative justice. Class material is very interesting, and not difficult. Put in some effort and you will receive a good grade.

I've had Brenda for Crim 315 and 417. I would highly recommend taking any course that you can with her. She is highly respected in the restorative justice community and is very passionate about her work. Her marking is not easy, but if you become passionate about what you learn, which you probably will, you will find her grading to be very fair.

My only complaints: not enough instructions on what they were looking for in the journals (besides vague references to class, articles, and book) and they were marked HARD by the TAs. In some weeks, the DVD was like 3 hrs long. You gotta add in the fact that you need to rewind the DVD sometimes so the time you spend is much longer than that.

there are 4 journals and you have to use class material, tutorial material, the BORING dvds (which are very expensive), and the readings for each week. the ta's are really picky about using everything in your journals. guest speakers were cool, the tutorial activities were fun, and overall, the class was okay.

Course is reading and writing intensive. Journals are marked pretty hard by the TAs. Prof and TAs shove RJ down your throat, any dissenting opinion will earn you a poor mark. Course is basically one long informercial on how awesome RJ is. Materials are mandatory & expensive. Only redeeming aspect of the course is the fun tutorials.

If you heard this class was easy, think again. Journals are now done differently than what you may have heard from others who took this class and the TAs actually mark quite hard. Tutorials are fun, but lectures seem disconnected. Many of the comments on this site are pretty accurate. Take this class at your own risk. Lots of work and GPA dropper.

Took Restorative Justice Crim315 with her. Her lectures are quite random leaving you clueless on what you learned at the end of the lectures. Videos required are long and boring. This course is implicit rather than explicit learning.

Not structured at all!!! Powerpoint slides are all over the place, i dont even think I learned anything which is a shame because I was really looking forward to this class. Sounds more interesting than it is. Tutorial were great! Very easy marks, all we did was play games but the journals were ALOT of work! TA's make the class good.

This was one of the best classes I've ever had at SFU. I was admittedly very skeptical of the whole RJ thing but the course really opened my eyes. Brenda was also our TA and our tutorial group was very tight by the end of it! For those who say it's hard to get an A... just personally engage with the material rather than trying to read and memorize

I will have to disagree with most of the comments here. This class is not an easy class. Given the course load, this should at least be 6 credits. Countless hours of DVD readings, annoying emails, and long readings. Journals also takes longer than what was stated on the syllabus. Not a GPA booster, EASY B, but hard A. If a B boosts your GPA,goahead

This class is easy going, the lectures are boring sometimes, but you get to watch a gang member, and murders speack to you, tutorial are so fun, Melissa is awesome, NO EXAMS, just journal writing and watching $115 worth boring DVD set...Take the class it is easy marks and stressless

I'm sorry but I don't know what all the hype is about.  The class is boring as sin, she can't teach very well at all, and she didn't even start teaching about "Restorative Justice" until week 8.  The only good thing is the tutorials... make sure you get Melissa!  Best TA at SFU!

i loved this course! brenda is really interesting to listen too.  Both brenda and the TA's were really friendly.  Easy marks for an interesting class.  I reccommend this class to anyone, it really opens your eyes to RJ

Boring course but easy class. Journals and participation and in class final. No midterm/final and interesting guest speakers. DONT underestimate the journals cause this course can be a GPA booster if you put in the thought/effort. If you slack, don't be surprised with a lower mark. Guarenteed least a B even if you are ignorant. A+ if ur a tad smart

Brenda is a great prof. She really knows her stuff and is very interested in RJ. I had Melissa as a TA and she is great! She is really nice and very helpful. Brenda brought in really good guest speakers. Over all a very good prof, I would take another class with her again.
Really easy as long as you attend her class. The TA is not bad either

AMAZING COURSE - and the prof is super-helpful.  She had a family emergency which is why she wasn't present (re:previous post).  She's not used to big lecture halls, but don't hold that against her - she REALLY knows her stuff!!!

It might be nice if she actually showed up when we had a guest speaker...you know, show some interest in the course perhaps.  Tutorials are AWESOME, TAs AMAZING. No final, which is nice and the journals are an easy mark if you incorporate the readings and tutorial content.  Lectures are a snooze fest except for guest speakers who have been great!
